noteLab.model.geom
Class MAffineTransform

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.geom.AffineTransform
      noteLab.model.geom.MAffineTransform
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class MAffineTransform
extends java.awt.geom.AffineTransform

This class serves as a special type of AffineTransform that knows how to transform MValues, MPoints, MLines, MDimension, and MRectangles. Notice that Affine transforms can be specified by matrices and represent transformations that map lines to lines and preserves parallelism between lines.

Author:
Dominic Kramer
See Also:

Field Detail

unit

private Unit unit
The unit that this transformation uses when performing calculations.

Constructor Detail

MAffineTransform

public MAffineTransform(Unit unit)
Constructs a transformation using the given unit to perform calculations. This transformation uses the identity map and thus does not transform space in any way at all.

Parameters:
unit - The unit in which this transformation's calculations are performed.

MAffineTransform

public MAffineTransform(double[] transformArr,
                        Unit unit)
Constructs a transformation using the given unit to perform calculations. This transformation uses the given array which specifies a two by two matrix to transform space.

Parameters:
transformArr - Specifies the matrix that describes how space should be transformed. This array should contain four elements which correspond to the top-left, top-right, bottom-left, and bottom-right enteries in the matrix respectively.
unit - The unit in which this transformation's calculations are performed.
Method Detail

setMatrix

public void setMatrix(double[] matrix)
Used to set the matrix that this transformation uses to transform space.

Parameters:
matrix - Specifies the matrix that describes how space should be transformed. This array should contain four elements which correspond to the top-left, top-right, bottom-left, and bottom-right enteries in the matrix respectively.
